serinfo.issue: 2008 World, Europe, United States, Canada, and Mexico

descript.abstract:
United States 109th Congressional Districts represents the political boundaries for the U.S. 109th Congressional Districts. The membership is current as of August 25, 2006. Attribute information includes the state, district number, and area of the district as well as the name and party affiliation of the representative.
This dataset is a part of the 2008 ESRI Data & Maps collection.
descript.purpose: United States 109th Congressional Districts provides the locations of Congressional Districts, primarily for national planning applications.
descript.supplinf: Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:1,000,000.

Outside the United States Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local ESRI International Distributor. This information can be found at http://gis.esri.com/intldist/contact/.
For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.2.1350

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using either ESRI SDC Data Development Kit Professional 2 (DDKP2) or tools in ArcGIS. The SDC data set is then loaded into ArcSDE to verify and validate the geometry.
dataqual.complete:
After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.
Line simplification and smoothing was performed with a tolerance of 0.005 decimal degrees and a coordinate reduction using the Douglas-Peucker method with a tolerance of 0.0003 decimal degrees. Very small polygons were eliminated when the combination of geographic codes existed elsewhere.

citeinfo.othercit: NAME and PARTY attribute information was updated based on news reports following the November 5, 2002 election.

citeinfo.othercit: Downloaded only the data for Pennsylvania.

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by ESRI: Converted to North American Datum of 1983 (NAD83). Added features for Alaska, Hawaii, and Puerto Rico from the ESRI Data & Maps 2002 U.S. 107th Congressional Districts. Corrected attribute value consistency problems. Replaced the entire outer boundary of the continental U.S. (coastlines and international) with features from the U.S. 107th Congressional Districts. Generalized to a tolerance of 0.0003 decimal degrees. Created region (multi-poly) features based on the four-digit state/district id. Then formatted the attributes to match the common attributes in the U.S. 107th Congressional Districts. The values for the attributes, NAME and PARTY, were completed from The Associated Press and National Committee for an Effective Congress. In two records, the winner was still undecided, and the NAME and PARTY attributes were coded with "TBD". Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices. Converted the data set to SDC.

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Added SQMI attribute and calculated its values. Updated Congressional District information that was not available at the time of the last release (December 2003).

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Copied the ESRI Data & Maps 2004 U.S. 108th Congressional Districts and renamed it. Updated the Maine and Texas boundaries. Updated the attribute values to represent the 109th Congress. Corrected the values for DISTRICTID attribute by changing 'xx99' to 'xx00'. Added the new value of 'Vacant' to the PARTY attribute. Recalculated the SQMI attribute values. Reduced the attribute width for NAME.

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Updated member information for the California 48th and 50th congressional districts, the Ohio 2nd congressional district, and the New Jersey 13th congressional district. Removed Alaskan islands west of 180 degrees longitude. Changed attribute SQMI to display only two decimal places. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.
The following steps were performed by ESRI: Updated member information for two California and Texas congressional districts.

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Copied the ESRI Data & Maps 2006 U.S. 109th Congressional Districts (CD) and converted to shapefile. Downloaded 2006 TIGER/Line files for Pennsylvania from the U.S. Census Bureau website, extracted out block polygons, and converted to shapefile. Dissolved block polygons on the CD ID to create the updated Pennsylvania CD boundaries shapefile. Deleted old Pennsylvania features from the 109th CD shapefile and saved them into a separate shapefile. Extended all exterior boundaries of the updated Pennsylvania CD shapefile, and then clipped them back using the old Pennsylvania features to ensure coincidence with the adjacent state boundaries and with the coastline detail. Added and calculated attributes in the updated Pennsylvania shapefile, including new SQMI values, to match the 109th CD shapefile. Merged the updated Pennsylvania shapefile with the 109th CD shapefile. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.

enttyp.enttypd: An area established by state officials or the courts for the purpose of electing a person to the U.S. House of Representatives. Within each state, these areas must contain, as nearly as possible, an equal number of inhabitants. The number of congressional districts in each state may change after each decennial census, and the boundaries may be changed more than once during a decade.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The name of the representative for the congressional district.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, Census Bureau; The Associated Press; National Committee for an Effective Congress; Clerk for the U.S. House of Representatives

attr.attrdef: The political party of the representative for the congressional district.
attr.attrdefs: The Associated Press; National Committee for an Effective Congress; Clerk for the U.S. House of Representatives

edom.edomvd: The representative has resigned, died, or declined to serve.

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The FIPS code (two-digit number) for the state in which the congressional district is located.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The two-letter abbreviation for the state in which the congressional district is located.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The area of the congressional district in square miles.
